RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the vehicles: white Malibu sedan and black Dodge pickup truck

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan: a vehicle mentioned as a white sedan, involved in the incident at the Freer immigration checkpoint, lacked a wind farm sticker, designed to hold five people, stopped by Agent Trevino and found to be transporting illegals, registered to Dallas-Fort Worth as a rental vehicle, traveling in tandem with a black Dodge pickup truck, driven by RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR., sped away at around eighty miles per hour
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.black Dodge pickup truck: a black truck with a camper, suspected of being used to transport illegal aliens, lacked a wind farm sticker, believed to be connected to the white Malibu sedan, subject of a BOLO, stopped by Officer Reymundo Reyes for not using a turning signal, registered to Corinth, Texas, had a dark blue or black camper
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan and black Dodge picku: vehicles jointly involved in the incident at the Freer immigration checkpoint, with out-of-town registrations, traveling in tandem on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, driven by RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., lacked wind farm stickers
